channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Street lighting, 16th August
item.description:
The street light is not working on the entrance to Glynbridge gardens by the bridge. Second street light is not working in the conifers of 1 Patterdale Close
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Glynbridge Gardens, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Muddy mess, 16th August
item.description:
Due to cars parking on the verge during school runs the verge is now ruined containing large holes and mud with all grass being killed off. It would make sense to tarmac and level this area to make the footpath better but to also include school “pencil” bollards to stop cars parking on the verge.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 8, Bedford Avenue, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Birch tree trim back, 16th August
item.description:
Low hanging leaves and branches need trimming back to enable pedestrians to walk freely. Branches are blocking street light particularly on windy days Growth is surrounding overhead telephone cabling to local properties
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 46, Dorset Avenue, Rowanfield, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree stump outside Mira Showers, has become a public bin and the verge cannot be maintained around it. Please resolve what is supposed to only be a temporary safety measure., 15th August
item.description:
On the Mira Showers side of the road, close to the traffic calming measure.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 156, Cromwell Road, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Tree causing damage/obstruction to pavement or road

item.title: Tree stump remains after 3 months, becoming a dumping ground for litter and an eye sore with the vegetation growing around it. The safety bollards were a temporary measure, and the problem should really have been resolved by now., 15th August

item.title: Broken slab in pavement on Albany Roaf, 15th August
item.description:
There is a particularly badly broken paving slab on the pavement in Albany Road close to where it meets Alexandra Street. It looks as if it might deepen and increase the likelihood of being a trip hazard.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17, Albany Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham

item.title: The sign states that the railway bridge is 13ft high., 15th August
item.description:
Today a lorry got stuck under the railway bridge. The sign down the road states the clearance height is 13feet. Due to the dip under the bridge, this lowers the height. So not only is the lorry damaged, Railway personnel are here checking, that trains can continue to use. The sign really needs to be changed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 31, Wymans Lane, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocking visibility on road/junction (Grass/verge) problem, 15th August
item.description:
Customer is requesting that grass verge be cut as it has grown very long and passers-by throw refuse in it. State that they have paid to have the verge cut for the past few years as it has not been done.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 15th August
item.description:
Dear Andrew, I was given your name by the Cheltenham tree surgeon who told me that your department is responsible for pruning all public trees on pavements in Cheltenham. etc. There is an enormous tree near 8 Selkirk St ( which has a TPO on it) but which has grown massively in the last 10 years. I have taken several pictures from my garden (Larkspur House, Pittville Circus) to show how it is now impacting the light which I receive into my garden - especially in late Summer when the sun begins to drop behind it. I would be very grateful if you could have a look at it and even grateful if you would consider pruning its enormous crown. Perhaps, if this is just a matter of finding the appropriate funds, I could make a contribution to the cost of this. I look forward to your reply and will try now to attach the photos which I have taken - pictures often being more valuable than words.Apologies I will send a picture later! Kind regards,
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: TMC - Defects - Vegetation problem, 15th August
item.description:
IN HOUSE ARB TEAM:BGG: Remove all dead wood from the lime tree outside of residents property. If need be crown lift as you see fit and remove any basal growth and epicormic growth by 6M.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: TMC - Defects - Vegetation problem, 15th August
item.description:
28 day with road closure needed please cut back overgrown hedge an vegetation an back to boundary appropriately 20000 x2000m high (Overgrown Hedge)
Report on FixMyStreet
